title: [P1][Repo] Finalize monorepo layout + base repo hygiene
description:
## Goal
Establish the final CueMetrics monorepo structure and baseline repo hygiene so every contributor (including future you) can navigate and run the project without guessing.

## Scope
### In scope
- Create and commit the agreed monorepo folders:
  - `apps/mobile_flutter/`
  - `services/api_fastapi/`
  - `services/worker_cv/`
  - `packages/` (placeholders ok)
  - `infra/`
  - `docs/`
  - `tools/` (optional helper scripts)
- Add baseline repo files:
  - `README.md` (high-level project intro + links)
  - `AGENTS.md` (agent instruction rules)
  - `.gitignore` (Flutter + Python + IDE + OS)
  - `LICENSE` (choose one)

### Out of scope
- Any product feature implementation
- Any CV logic

## Deliverables
- Folder structure committed
- Repo opens cleanly in IDE
- `README.md` includes:
  - one-liner
  - local setup pointer to `/docs/DEV_SETUP.md`
  - how to run api/worker/mobile (links ok)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Repo structure matches `/docs/ARCHITECTURE.md`
- [ ] `README.md` links to the main docs (PLAN/FEATURES/ARCHITECTURE/API/DATASET/DEV_SETUP)
- [ ] `.gitignore` prevents common build/cache artifacts

## Notes
Keep it minimal and stable. Don’t over-engineer tooling here.

title: [P1][Docs] Add .env.example + document environment variables
description:
## Goal
Create a clear `.env.example` for local development and document required environment variables for API + worker + mobile.

## Scope
### In scope
- Add `.env.example` at repo root (or per-service if you prefer, but keep consistent)
- Include variables for:
  - `DATABASE_URL`
  - `REDIS_URL`
  - `STORAGE_PROVIDER`
  - `S3_ENDPOINT`
  - `S3_BUCKET`
  - `S3_ACCESS_KEY`
  - `S3_SECRET_KEY`
  - `ENV` / `LOG_LEVEL`
  - any API base url config note for mobile
- Update `/docs/DEV_SETUP.md` with:
  - where env lives
  - how to load it
  - common misconfigurations

### Out of scope
- Production secrets management

## Deliverables
- `.env.example`
- DEV_SETUP.md updated

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Fresh clone + copy `.env.example` → `.env` works for local run
- [ ] Variables are named consistently across API + worker

## Notes
Prefer simple env loading. Avoid multiple conflicting env files unless necessary.

title: [P1][Infra] Create docker-compose for Postgres + Redis
description:
## Goal
Provide a one-command local infrastructure stack for development.

## Scope
### In scope
- Add `infra/docker-compose.yml` with:
  - Postgres
  - Redis
  - persistent Postgres volume
  - ports exposed on localhost
- Add minimal DB init if needed (optional): `infra/sql/init.sql`
- Add helper scripts (optional but recommended):
  - `infra/scripts/dev_up.sh`
  - `infra/scripts/dev_down.sh`
  - `infra/scripts/reset_db.sh` (drop + recreate schema)

### Out of scope
- Kubernetes
- Managed Redis/Postgres config

## Deliverables
- `docker compose up -d` starts Postgres and Redis
- `docker compose logs -f` shows running services

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Postgres reachable at `localhost:5432`
- [ ] Redis reachable at `localhost:6379`
- [ ] Services restart cleanly

## Notes
Keep default credentials strictly for local dev only.

title: [P1][API] Bootstrap FastAPI service skeleton + /v1/health
description:
## Goal
Create the FastAPI service skeleton with a stable entrypoint and a health endpoint.

## Scope
### In scope
- Create `services/api_fastapi/app/main.py`
- Implement `/v1/health` returning `{ "status": "ok" }`
- Add config loader:
  - reads env
  - validates required vars (at least DATABASE_URL, REDIS_URL, storage placeholders)
- Add structured logging baseline (JSON or consistent text)

### Out of scope
- Auth
- Real endpoints beyond health

## Deliverables
- `uvicorn app.main:app --reload --port 8000` works
- OpenAPI docs available

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `/v1/health` returns 200 consistently
- [ ] Missing required env fails fast with clear error

## Notes
Keep it minimal. This is a foundation for later API endpoints.

title: [P1][API] Standardize error envelope + request_id middleware
description:
## Goal
Implement a consistent, production-grade error response format and a request_id that appears in logs and error responses.

## Scope
### In scope
- Add middleware:
  - generate `request_id` per request
  - attach to response headers (e.g., `X-Request-ID`)
  - include in logs
- Implement error envelope (match `/docs/API.md` conventions):
  - `error.code`
  - `error.message`
  - `error.details` (optional)
  - `error.request_id`
- Add handlers for:
  - validation errors (422)
  - HTTPException
  - unhandled exceptions (500)

### Out of scope
- Full observability stack

## Deliverables
- All errors returned in standard envelope

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] A bad request returns envelope + request_id
- [ ] A server error returns envelope + request_id (no stack trace leak)
- [ ] Request_id appears in logs for the request

## Notes
This pays dividends later—do it early and keep it consistent.

title: [P1][Worker] Bootstrap worker skeleton + Redis connection
description:
## Goal
Create the worker service that can connect to Redis and process a dummy job.

## Scope
### In scope
- Create `services/worker_cv/worker/main.py` (entrypoint)
- Connect to Redis queue
- Implement a dummy job handler:
  - accepts `session_id`
  - logs start/end
  - writes a dummy result somewhere (DB or file) OR marks status in DB later (stub ok for now)

### Out of scope
- Actual CV pipeline
- S3 integration

## Deliverables
- Worker can run locally and wait for jobs

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Worker starts without errors
- [ ] Worker can execute a dummy job end-to-end

## Notes
Choose queue library now (RQ or Celery). Keep it minimal but reliable.

title: [P1][CI] Add baseline CI for Python + Flutter (lint/test/analyze)
description:
## Goal
Establish CI quality gates early to prevent regressions.

## Scope
### In scope
- Add `.github/workflows/ci.yml` with jobs:
  - Python API: ruff/black/pytest
  - Python worker: ruff/black/pytest
  - Flutter: `flutter analyze` + format check
- Keep CI fast and deterministic

### Out of scope
- Deployment workflows

## Deliverables
- CI runs on PR
- CI fails on lint/format/test errors

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] CI passes on main branch
- [ ] CI fails when formatting is incorrect

## Notes
Prefer shared configs across services to avoid drift.

title: [P2][DB] Implement initial Postgres schema + Alembic migrations (MVP tables)
description:
## Goal
Implement the MVP database schema with migrations so API/worker can persist sessions, table profiles, and outputs.

## Scope
### In scope
Create tables (minimal viable columns):
- `users` (stub for now)
- `table_profiles`
- `sessions`
- `shots`
- `events`
- `tracks`
- `artifacts`

Required MVP fields:
- `sessions.status` enum
- lifecycle timestamps: `queued_at`, `started_at`, `finished_at`
- failure info: `failure_code`, `failure_message`

Indexes:
- sessions: `(user_id, created_at desc)`
- shots: `(session_id, index)` unique
- events: `(shot_id, t)`

### Out of scope
- Multi-tenant organization schema

## Deliverables
- Alembic migrations
- `/docs/DATABASE.md` updated to match

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `alembic upgrade head` creates schema cleanly
- [ ] Downgrade is possible (at least one step)
- [ ] Basic CRUD works in API with DB session

## Notes
Keep schema flexible but not vague. Prefer explicit enums and constraints.

title: [P2][API] Implement sessions CRUD (create/list/get) with status machine
description:
## Goal
Create production-grade session CRUD endpoints and enforce valid status transitions.

## Scope
### In scope
Endpoints (per `/docs/API.md`):
- `POST /v1/sessions` create session
- `GET /v1/sessions` list sessions
- `GET /v1/sessions/{id}` get session details

Requirements:
- Status field exists and transitions are validated
- Include request_id in error responses
- Return consistent response schemas

### Out of scope
- Auth enforcement (can stub user_id)

## Deliverables
- Endpoints implemented
- DB integration working

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Create session returns session_id and status
- [ ] List sessions returns stable ordering (newest first)
- [ ] Get session returns full metadata and status
- [ ] Invalid session_id returns standard error envelope

## Notes
Implement status transitions centrally (helper function) so worker/API stay consistent.

title: [P2][API+Storage] Implement presigned upload URL + finalize upload flow
description:
## Goal
Enable mobile to upload a raw session video via presigned URL and finalize the upload so processing can begin.

## Scope
### In scope
- Storage integration wrapper (R2/S3 compatible)
- Endpoints:
  - `POST /v1/sessions/{id}/upload-url` → returns presigned PUT
  - `POST /v1/sessions/{id}/finalize-upload` → verifies metadata and moves status

Requirements:
- Store `video_uri` / storage key in DB
- Enforce status:
  - only allow upload-url when `UPLOADING` or created state
  - only finalize when upload is completed
- Return clear failure codes:
  - storage misconfig
  - invalid session status

### Out of scope
- Chunked upload (presigned only)

## Deliverables
- Upload works end-to-end from a script (curl) even before mobile integration

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Can upload any small MP4 via presigned URL
- [ ] Finalize updates session to `READY`
- [ ] Attempting to process before finalize is rejected with clear error

## Notes
Define storage key convention now (sessions/{session_id}/raw.mp4).

title: [P2][Queue] Implement enqueue processing endpoint + job payload schema
description:
## Goal
Allow API to enqueue a processing job for a READY session.

## Scope
### In scope
- Define job payload schema:
  - `{ session_id, pipeline_version, options }`
- Endpoint:
  - `POST /v1/sessions/{id}/process`
- Validate status transitions:
  - only READY → QUEUED
- Persist `queued_at`
- Worker must accept this payload (even if dummy at first)

### Out of scope
- Priority queues

## Deliverables
- API enqueues a job and returns job status

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Calling process on READY session sets status to QUEUED
- [ ] Calling process on non-READY returns clear error
- [ ] Worker receives and logs payload

## Notes
Ensure job enqueue failures surface clearly to user.

title: [P2][Worker] Implement job lifecycle updates (QUEUED→PROCESSING→DONE/FAILED)
description:
## Goal
Make worker update session statuses reliably and persist lifecycle timestamps + failure reasons.

## Scope
### In scope
- On job start:
  - set status PROCESSING
  - set `started_at`
- On success:
  - set status DONE
  - set `finished_at`
- On failure:
  - set status FAILED
  - set `failure_code`, `failure_message`
  - set `finished_at`
- Ensure idempotency:
  - if already DONE, skip
  - if PROCESSING stale, allow retry

### Out of scope
- Actual CV work

## Deliverables
- Worker writes lifecycle updates to DB

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Status changes correctly visible via `GET /sessions/{id}`
- [ ] Failure is persisted with readable message
- [ ] Duplicate runs do not duplicate outputs

## Notes
This is foundational for debuggability and UX.

title: [P2][Worker] Implement dummy processing output: shots + artifacts placeholders
description:
## Goal
Before real CV exists, produce dummy but realistic outputs so mobile UX can be built end-to-end.

## Scope
### In scope
- Worker creates:
  - 3–10 dummy shots per session
  - dummy artifact entries (thumbnail/clip/overlay placeholders)
- Persist in DB:
  - shots table
  - artifacts table

### Out of scope
- Real video parsing

## Deliverables
- `GET /sessions/{id}/shots` returns a list
- `GET /shots/{id}` returns details

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Mobile can render shot list and details from dummy outputs
- [ ] Artifacts have signed URL placeholders or local placeholders

## Notes
Keep schemas future-proof but don’t overfit to dummy data.

title: [P2][API] Implement table profiles CRUD (create/list/get/update)
description:
## Goal
Support creating and managing table profiles (calibration data) so sessions can reference a stable table geometry.

## Scope
### In scope
Endpoints:
- `POST /v1/table-profiles`
- `GET /v1/table-profiles`
- `GET /v1/table-profiles/{id}`
- `PATCH /v1/table-profiles/{id}`

Data requirements:
- store corners (4 points)
- store pocket centers (6 points)
- store calibration quality score (optional now)
- store nickname/location

### Out of scope
- Auto-detection of corners/pockets

## Deliverables
- Table profiles usable by mobile to select at recording time

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Can create profile and retrieve it
- [ ] Input validation catches missing/invalid points
- [ ] Update works and is reflected in get/list

## Notes
Define point ordering in schema and document it in API.md.

title: [P2][API+Storage] Implement artifact signed URL retrieval endpoint
description:
## Goal
Provide secure access to artifacts (raw video, clips, thumbnails, overlay JSON) via signed URLs.

## Scope
### In scope
- Endpoint (per API.md):
  - `GET /v1/artifacts/{id}` → returns signed GET URL
- Ensure:
  - artifacts stored in DB
  - URL expiration time configured
- Add basic access checks (can stub user_id for now)

### Out of scope
- CDN optimizations

## Deliverables
- Mobile can request a signed URL and play/display artifact

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Signed URL works for existing artifact key
- [ ] Missing artifact returns standard error envelope
- [ ] URLs expire after configured duration

## Notes
This is critical for privacy and production readiness.

title: [P3][Mobile] Initialize Flutter app shell + navigation structure
description:
## Goal
Create the mobile app shell with navigation and placeholder screens to support the MVP user journey.

## Scope
### In scope
- Set up Flutter project structure (feature-first)
- Create navigation with these top-level routes:
  - Sessions (home)
  - Record
  - Table Profiles
  - Settings (optional placeholder)
- Add placeholder screens with proper loading/empty/error components

### Out of scope
- Camera recording implementation

## Deliverables
- App runs on iOS + Android emulator

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Navigation works cleanly
- [ ] Screens are placeholders but structured correctly
- [ ] App compiles with no analyzer warnings

## Notes
Keep architecture simple and consistent across features.

title: [P3][Mobile] Implement design system tokens + reusable UI components
description:
## Goal
Create a cohesive UI foundation so all future screens look consistent and can be built quickly.

## Scope
### In scope
- Theme tokens:
  - typography scale
  - spacing scale
  - color tokens
- Reusable components:
  - `CMButton` (primary/secondary)
  - `CMCard`
  - `CMBadge` (status)
  - `CMLoader` / skeleton
  - `CMEmptyState`
  - `CMErrorBanner`

### Out of scope
- Pixel-perfect final branding

## Deliverables
- Components used by Sessions screen

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] At least 2 screens use shared components
- [ ] Loading/empty/error states are consistent across app

## Notes
Optimize for speed + clarity. Keep components minimal.

title: [P3][Mobile+API] Implement API client layer + error mapping
description:
## Goal
Create a typed API client layer so the mobile app can talk to the backend reliably.

## Scope
### In scope
- API client foundation:
  - base URL config (dev vs prod)
  - request_id handling (if exposed)
  - retries for transient errors
- DTOs for:
  - sessions
  - shots
  - table profiles
  - artifact URLs
- Error mapping:
  - parse standard error envelope
  - show user-friendly messages

### Out of scope
- Auth

## Deliverables
- Mobile can call `/v1/health`
- Mobile can list sessions

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Network errors show readable messages
- [ ] API errors show envelope message + remediation hints (where possible)

## Notes
Keep network layer isolated from UI widgets.

title: [P3][Mobile] Sessions list screen (status, summary cards, states)
description:
## Goal
Build the Sessions list screen with production-quality UX states and basic session metadata display.

## Scope
### In scope
- Sessions list UI:
  - status badge (UPLOADING/READY/PROCESSING/DONE/FAILED)
  - created_at
  - shot count (if available)
  - make% placeholder (if available)
- States:
  - loading skeleton
  - empty state (no sessions)
  - error state with retry
- Pull-to-refresh

### Out of scope
- Recording

## Deliverables
- Sessions list renders from API

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Shows correct status and updates after refresh
- [ ] Empty and error states look intentional

## Notes
Use reusable components from the design system.

title: [P3][Mobile] Session detail screen (summary + shots list)
description:
## Goal
Build the Session detail screen so users can see processing status, summary metrics, and a list of shots.

## Scope
### In scope
- Session header:
  - status
  - timestamps
  - failure message (if FAILED)
- Summary cards:
  - total shots
  - makes/misses (if present)
  - low-confidence count (placeholder)
- Shots list:
  - index
  - outcome badge
  - confidence indicator
  - thumbnail (if available)
- States:
  - loading
  - empty (no shots yet)
  - error

### Out of scope
- Full overlay rendering (next issue)

## Deliverables
- User can tap session → see shot list

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Works with dummy shots produced by worker
- [ ] Clearly shows when processing is still in progress

## Notes
Design for clarity: users should always know what to do next.

title: [P3][Mobile] Shot detail screen with video playback (no overlays yet)
description:
## Goal
Enable users to open a shot and play its clip smoothly.

## Scope
### In scope
- Shot detail screen:
  - video player for clip URL
  - show outcome badge + confidence
  - show metadata (shot index, time range)
- States:
  - loading
  - error (clip not available)
  - retry

### Out of scope
- Drawing overlays (trajectory) — later

## Deliverables
- Clip playback works using signed URLs

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Can play a clip from a signed URL
- [ ] Handles expired URL by requesting again (or shows retry)

## Notes
This is the core review experience foundation.

title: [P3][Mobile] Table profiles list + create entry flow (UI only)
description:
## Goal
Allow users to view table profiles and start creating a new one (calibration UI will come later).

## Scope
### In scope
- Table Profiles screen:
  - list profiles
  - empty state
  - create button
- Create flow entry:
  - profile name
  - optional location note
  - save via API

### Out of scope
- Corner/pocket tapping UI (calibration)

## Deliverables
- User can create a named table profile record

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Profiles list renders from API
- [ ] Create profile works and appears immediately

## Notes
Calibration data can be added later via update endpoint.

title: [P3][Mobile] Add processing status polling + UI updates
description:
## Goal
When a session is processing, the mobile app should poll the backend and reflect status updates smoothly.

## Scope
### In scope
- Poll session status while:
  - QUEUED
  - PROCESSING
- Backoff strategy:
  - fast at first (e.g., every 2–3s), then slower
  - stop polling on DONE/FAILED
- UI:
  - show processing indicator
  - show failure remediation message

### Out of scope
- Push notifications

## Deliverables
- Session list and detail auto-update without manual refresh

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Polling stops when terminal state reached
- [ ] Polling doesn’t drain device excessively
- [ ] Status changes are reflected in UI

## Notes
Make polling logic reusable and testable.
